channel.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
channel.description:
What should I learn and use: C4D or 3DS Max?
I've looked at various forum threads with the same questions and have looked at comparison tables, but I still haven't been able to make a final decision.
I will be primarily making models for games. What are the differences in the learning curve for C4D and 3DS Max? I heard C4D is really easy to learn to use.

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:10, topic:249878”][quote author=ZeroFreeze link=topic=329412.msg2576503#msg2576503 date=1228975886]
Thanks guys, I’ve decided to use 3DS Max.

Also I think you will save a lot of time and effort if you use wings3d for simple game objects such as props. You know… shit like tables and chair, or stuff that goes on the tables. Wings3d is so incredibly easy to use.

Thanks, I’ll take a look at the program.

What’s C4D used for mostly by the way?
[/quote]

The same shit the other programs are used for.
Though the two majorities I think are character rigging and architecture.[/quote]
the engineering company taylor woodrow use C4D as their rendering program for when they start testing buildings

Read full topic

Also I think you will save a lot of time and effort if you use wings3d for simple game objects such as props. You know… shit like tables and chair, or stuff that goes on the tables. Wings3d is so incredibly easy to use.

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

If you want to be a succesful designer then you have to learn 3DS Max

But I would want to learn both, it’d be nice just to have some work you’ve done with C4D on your resume

Read full topic

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

sanga282:

ILM one of the best special FX companies in the world use 3DS, they used it for the Ironman film and the results they got were amazing

A lot of the time they use their own proprietary stuff though.
But it’s not like ILM used 3dsmax. They used 3dsmax with all the custom shit their developers wrote for it.
That and Maya are very popular because of that.

Read full topic

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Use max for game modelling.

Also I think you will save a lot of time and effort if you use wings3d for simple game objects such as props. You know… shit like tables and chair, or stuff that goes on the tables. Wings3d is so incredibly easy to use.

I always used maya though because I learned it at school. I only ever created low poly game models, nothing fancy like STH posts.

sanga282:

ILM one of the best special FX companies in the world use 3DS, they used it for the Ironman film and the results they got were amazing

Imo Maya is the best for animation. Though I haven’t used 3d studio max since version 6.

Read full topic

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

For game modeling, also, the C4D tools are kinda below par in comparison with Max’s.

Read full topic

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I dont like max, it seems weird to me. C4D is much more easy to use when you have been using for a while.

Ive seen people work with max, it seems pretty good. Like STH said, personal preference.

Read full topic

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

ZeroFreeze:

I will be primarily making models for games.

3DS Max is pretty much the industry standard for game modelling. Sure there are shops using other software, but if you know Max, you already have a key skill they don’t have to teach you.

Starting off on C4D to get the basics down would be fine if you want to, but I seriously recommend learning Max. Going into games development without ever planning to use max would be like going into engine development without ever wishing to learn C++.

Read full topic

item.title: C4D or 3DS Max?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

It is easy, but in the long run 3DS is better.

It’s personal preference though.

Read full topic
